Murray St. tops Western Ky.

Saturday, December 6, 2014 Kentuckiana men's and women's college basketball roundup, scores, boxscores and Sunday schedules

Murray St. tops Western Ky.

From AP and special dispatches 12:15 a.m. EST December 7, 2014

Louisville's Terrence Jennings scores a basket during the second half of their NCAA college basketball game against Oral Roberts Wednesday Dec. 16, 2009 in Louisville, Ky. Louisville defeated Oral Roberts 94-57. (AP Photo/Timothy D. Easley)(Photo: Timothy D. Easley)

CONNECT 2 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Jarvis Williams scored 24 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in leading host Murray State to a 93-81 victory over Western Kentucky on Saturday night.

Both teams shot well, Murray State (5-4) making 56.7 percent, including 11 3-pointers, and Western Kentucky 52.8.

The double-double was Williams' third this season. Cameron Payne also scored 24 points and T.J. Sapp 19.

T.J. Price led WKU with 21 points. George Fant added 19.

The Racers were up 20 points two minutes into the second half before WKU stormed back, getting within four before Murray State pulled away.

WKU (3-4) shot 55 percent for its best first half in the last 26 games but still trailed by 17 at the break thanks to an early 19-0 run by Murray State.

•Oakland 70, Morehead State 68, OT: Corey Petros hit a jumper in the lane with 1.6 seconds left in overtime to give visiting Oakland (4-5) the win over the Eagles (4-7).

Lyonell Gaines scored four points in overtime for Morehead State, including a putback with 32 seconds left to tie it before Petros hit the game-winner. Petros had 25 points and 10 rebounds, and Kahlil Felder 13 points and seven assists to lead Oakland.

Angelo Warner scored four points during an 11-2 run to give Morehead State a 61-59 lead with 2:06 remaining in regulation. Dante Williams split a pair of free throws and Felder and Petros scored to give Oakland back the lead, 64-61 with 38 seconds left. Corban Collins drained a trey to tie it with 29 seconds to go, and Petros missed a layup to send it to overtime.

Gaines had 18 points and 10 boards to lead Morehead State.

•Spalding 61, MacMurray 59: Donnie Lewis made three free throws down the stretch to boost the visiting Golden Eagles (3-3, 1-1 SLIAC) over the Highlanders (1-5, 1-2). Brandon Goeing led Spalding with 30 points on 11 of 16 shooting. Clayton Whitlock scored 18 points for MacMurray.

Alice Lloyd 63, IU Southeast 53

Asbury 67, Tenn. Temple 64

Berea 90, Morthland 70

Brescia 80, Kentucky Christian 58

Campbellsville 73, Cumberland (Tenn.) 59

Hanover 62, Anderson 56

Indiana 95, Savannah St. 49

Indianapolis 99, Saint Joseph's 64

Kentucky Wesleyan 78, Salem International 65

Rose-Hulman 67, Transylvania 66

Boyce vs. Dayspring Bible, late

Georgetown at Wilberforce, late
